| ,22-/m1/s1 StdInChIKey_Ref = StdInChIKey = GCFBRXLSHGKWDP-XCGNWRKASA-N
}} 'Cefoperazone' is a third generation cephalosporin antibiotic, marketed by
Pfizer under the name 'Cefobid', and also marked by pharco B international under
the name of 'Cefazone' and also marketed by "sigmatec" under the name
"cefoperazone". It is one of few cephalosporin antibiotics effective in treating
[[Pseudomonas]] bacterial infections which are otherwise resistant to these
antibiotics.

Cefina-SB is a combination of sulbactam and cefoperazone. Cefoperazone exerts
its bactericidal effect by inhibiting the bacterial cell wall synthesis, and
sulbactam acts as a beta-lactamase inhibitor, to increase the antibacterial
activity of cefoperazone against beta-lactamase producing organisms. In some
countries, the combination is sold as Sulperazone. [http://www.gepach.com Gepach
International] markets this combination of Cefoperazone with Sulbactam under the
brand name 'Bacperazone'
